generif.text: Atrial fibrillation is associated with an increase in the expression of ADAM10 in the heart atrium

ADAM10 and ADAM17 are the best characterized members of the ADAM (A Disintegrin and Metalloproteinase) - family of transmembrane proteases. Both are involved diverse physiological and pathophysiological processes.For ADAM17 phosphatidylserine exposure is required to then induce its shedding function.

These findings may help to provide a method for treatment of HSCC

summary: Members of the ADAM family are cell surface proteins with a unique structure possessing both potential adhesion and protease domains. This gene encodes and ADAM family member that cleaves many proteins including TNF-alpha and E-cadherin. Alternate splicing results in multiple transcript variants encoding different proteins that may undergo similar processing. [provided by RefSeq, Feb 2016].
